ISSUE.TITLE: robots.txt pointing to wrong sitemap in multi-language store
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: nopCommerce version: 4.40 > Example of what is being displayed at the top of the auto-generated robots.txt file for my multi-store/multi-language nop: > ``` > User-agent: * > Sitemap: https://domain.com/en/sitemap.xml > Sitemap: https://domain.com/fr/sitemap.xml > Sitemap: https://domain.com/de/sitemap.xml > Host: https://domain.com/ > ``` > > The 3 Sitemaps listed above come back as HTTP ERROR 404. > > Shouldn't the correct sitemap be the following, which works as a combined sitemap for all languages? > ``` > Sitemap: https://domain.com/sitemap.xml > ``` > > This one works and Google seems happy with it. Source: https://www.nopcommerce.com/boards/topic/91616/nop4404-robotstxt-pointing-to-wrong-sitemap-in-multi-language-store Introduced in #5217

COMMIT.MESSAGE: #5791 Removed localizable URLs from robots.txt in the sitemap directive
